alert.note: Alert for Benton; Carroll; Crawford; Franklin; Madison; Sebastian; Washington (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 02 at 10:17PM CST until February 04 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...A mixture of freezing rain, sleet and snow. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches with local amounts up to 10 inches with heaviest snow totals near a line from Okfuskee county to Delaware county into portions of far northwest Arkansas. Snow and sleet accumulation of 1 to 5 inches southward to Pittsburg county into northwest and west central Arkansas. Ice accumulations across far southeast Oklahoma of one quarter to one half inch with isolated amounts to three quarters of an inch possible. Ice accumulations will decrease further north, however amounts near one quarter inch are possible across southeast Oklahoma into portions of west central Arkansas. * WHERE...Eastern Oklahoma and Northwest Arkansas. * WHEN...Through midnight CST Thursday night. Heaviest accumulations tonight through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Expect travel conditions to become hazardous. Heavy snow and blowing snow will produce near blizzard conditions across portions of northeast Oklahoma and far northwest Arkansas tonight. Power outages and tree damage are likely primarily across portions of southeast Oklahoma. Power outages of 24 hours and possibly up to several days should be anticipated across portions of far southeast Oklahoma. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Dangerous wind chill values will also develop tonight with values of zero to minus 10 degrees likely. Dangerous wind chills will persist into Friday morning with wind chills largely between 0 and minus 5 degrees within the warned area.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. A combination of gusty winds and significant ice accumulation on trees and power lines is expected, especially across portions of southeast Oklahoma which would cause power outages. Do not touch downed lines and report any power outages to your electric company. If you use a generator, please follow appropriate safety guidelines. In Arkansas, for the latest road conditions call 1-800-245- 1672 or go to idrivearkansas.com. In Oklahoma, for the latest road conditions call 1-844-465-4997 or go to okRoads.org.
